questions: What is a constructor in Java?
op1: a) A method that returns a value
op2: b) A method that has no return type
op3: c) A method that creates a new object

What is encapsulation?
op1: a) A way to restrict access to data and methods of a class
op2: b) A way to allow access to data and methods of a class
op3: c) A way to create new objects of a class
op4: d) A way to destroy objects of a class
answer: a) A way to restrict access to data and methods of a class

questions: Which of the following access modifiers restricts access to a class member to only within the class?

Which of the following is true about inheritance in Java?
op1: a) A subclass can inherit properties and methods of a superclass
op2: b) A superclass can inherit properties and methods of a subclass
op3: c) A subclass can only inherit methods of a superclass
op4: d) A superclass can only inherit properties of a subclass
answer: a) A subclass can inherit properties and methods of a superclass

questions: What is the keyword used to inherit a class in Java?
Which of the following is true about polymorphism in Java?
op1: a) It allows a variable to refer to objects of different classes
op2: b) It allows a variable to refer to only one object
op3: c) It allows a method to have multiple return types
op4: d) It allows a method to have only one parameter
answer: a) It allows a variable to refer to objects of different classes

Which of the following is true about the Object class in Java?
op1: a) Every class in Java inherits from the Object class
op2: b) The Object class cannot be inherited
op3: c) The Object class has no methods or properties
op4: d) The Object class is used to create objects of any class
answer: a) Every class in Java inherits from the Object class

Which of the following is an example of method overloading?
op1: a) Defining two methods with the same name but different parameters in the same class
op2: b) Defining two methods with the same name and parameters in the same class
op3: c) Defining two methods with different names and parameters in the same class
op4: d) Defining two methods with the same name and parameters in different classes
answer: a) Defining two methods with the same name but different parameters in the same class

questions: Which of the following is an example of method overriding?
op1: a) Defining two methods with the same name but different parameters in the same class
op2: b) Defining two methods with the same name and parameters in the same class
op3: c) Defining two methods with different names and parameters in the same class
op4: d) Defining two methods with the same name and parameters in different classes
answer: b) Defining two methods with the same name and parameters in the same class
